thread.title: Why surging Alabama will cover on road against Texas A&M
thread.title_full: Why surging Alabama will cover on road against Texas A&M | New York Post

author: Phil Steele
title: Why surging Alabama will cover on road against Texas A&M
text:
Football expert Phil Steele is the owner and publisher of Phil Steele’s College Football Preview, regarded as the college football bible. Get in-depth coverage of college and pro football 24/7/365 at PhilSteele.com. 
Alabama (-4) over TEXAS A&M: Alabama has won three straight games by an average score of 33-8 following a loss at home to Ole Miss. Texas A&M has a tremendous offense, but its defense still struggles, especially against the run.
Alabama’s strength on offense is the running game and it still has a dominant defense that is allowing just 265 yards per game. Aggies head coach Kevin Sumlin is just 1-6 against the Vegas line off a bye. Roll Tide roll. 
Oregon (+2) over WASHINGTON: Oregon has won 11 straight over Washington by an average of 25 points per game, but is a rare conference underdog this week. The Ducks have lost three games, but they still have plenty of offense as they are averaging 529 yards per game (319 rushing). The Huskies do have a solid defense, but they allowed 481 yards against Cal and USC ran for 190 yards (4.9 average) against them last week. Oregon covered at Michigan State earlier this year as an away ’dog and will do so again. 
Last week (NCAA): 1-1
Season: 5-7
